alert.note: Alert for Amite; Wilkinson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 2:17AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST FELICIANA, CENTRAL WEST BATON ROUGE, NORTHWESTERN ST. HELENA, SOUTHEASTERN POINTE COUPEE, EAST FELICIANA AND NORTHWESTERN EAST BATON ROUGE PARISHES, SOUTHEASTERN WILKINSON AND SOUTHWESTERN AMITE COUNTIES THROUGH 245 AM CST... At 217 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Zachary, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, New Roads, Jackson, St. Francisville, Clinton, Livonia, Slaughter, Wilson, Norwood, Wakefield, Spillman, Erwinville, Felps, and Brownfields. This includes Interstate 110 in Louisiana near mile marker 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
